title: Code attempting to use `thread_local!` with generics crash the compiler

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #[derive(Default)] struct S { a: Command, } impl S { thread_local! {static AA: S = S::default() } } ``` Code can be found in [this repo](https://github.com/ditsing/thread_local_generic/blob/main/src/lib.rs). I know this is not supported. (BTW when will thread_local with generic be supported?) ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c commit-date: 2022-04-04 host: aarch64-apple-darwin release: 1.60.0 LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no label after fn', compiler/rustc_span/src/source_map.rs:958:18 ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling thread_local_generic v0.1.0 (/Users/ditsing/Code/thread_local_generic) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no label after fn', compiler/rustc_span/src/source_map.rs:958:18 stack backtrace: 0: 0x102a13118 - ::fmt::h10cf06316d33e2a9 1: 0x102a5f808 - core::fmt::write::h1faf18c959c3a8df 2: 0x102a05104 - std::io::Write::write_fmt::h86ab231360bc97d2 3: 0x102a16e44 - std::panicking::default_hook::{{closure}}::h36e628ffaf3cd44f 4: 0x102a16abc - ::resolve_path_with_ribs 20: 0x10c4ec254 - ::resolve_qpath_anywhere 21: 0x10c4eaa98 - ::smart_resolve_path_fragment 22: 0x10c4ea930 - ::smart_resolve_path 23: 0x10c4de56c - ::visit_ty 24: 0x10c4e06b8 - std::sys::unix::thread::Thread::new::thread_start::h8ccdabc567c5eee0 42: 0x1a577c26c - __pthread_deallocate error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04) running on aarch64-apple-darwin note: compiler flags: --crate-type lib -C embed-bitcode=no -C split-debuginfo=unpacked -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `thread_local_generic` ```
